ElementRequestPointerLock.summary: The requestPointerLock() method of the interface lets you asynchronously ask for the pointer to be locked on the given element.

remarks.para: To track the success or failure of the request, it is necessary to listen for the and events at the level.

blockquote.para: In the current specification, requestPointerLock() only communicates the success or failure of the request by firing or events. A proposed update to the specification updates requestPointerLock() to return a which communicates success or failure. This page documents the version that returns a . However, note that this version is not yet a standard and is not implemented by all browsers. See Browser compatibility for more information.
